column2: NEW JERSEY DMV TEST
column4: New Jersey
column6: NJ

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Drivers may drive on public or private property to avoid a traffic sign or signal:
column4: only if their speed is 15 MPH or less.
column6: only when directed to do so by a police officer.
column8: only with permission of the property owner.

column2: 2. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: slow down or move over safely.
column6: distance yourself from the situation.

column2: 3. If you are driving behind a school bus with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: speed up and pass.
column6: slow down to 10 MPH and pass the bus.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column6: Do not enter

column2: 5. A flashing yellow light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 6. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Always rely on
column6: It is not recommended to check

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Merging Traffic
column6: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 8. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: sound the horn.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 9. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column4: Anti-Collision Driving
column6: Defensive Driving

column2: 10. This warning sign means:
column4: Watch out for children crossing the street
column6: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children

column2: 21. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column6: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 22. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column6: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column10: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.

column2: 23. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 24. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 25. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road
column6: Divided highway ends

column2: 26. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column10: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.

column2: 27. The picture shows:
column4: a no-right-turn sign.
column6: a speeding fines doubled sign.

column2: 28. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: diamond shaped.
column6: round.

column2: 29. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They always have the right-of-way.
column6: They don’t have rearview mirrors.
column10: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 30. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: at roundabouts.
column6: on multiple lane highways.

column2: 31. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column8: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column10: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.

column2: 32. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 33. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 34. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column6: a reduction of lanes.
column10: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 35. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: improves your reaction time.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column10: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 36. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 37. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Destination signs (guide signs)
column6: Warning signs

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: Warning: sharp left turn ahead.
column6: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 39. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way
column6: Do not enter

column2: 41. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 42. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: Divided highway begins

column2: 43. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: stare straight ahead at all times.
column8: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column10: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.

column2: 44. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column10: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 45. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 46. Green and white signs:
column4: give information about directions and distances.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 47. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 48. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 49. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop if you can.
column6: Stop.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 50. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
